personal.name: Ankur Rakesh Ujawane
personal.title: Robotics Enthusiast
personal.persona: Future Robotics Engineer • Robotics Research Enthusiast • AI + Robotics Integrator
personal.tagline: I'm ready to work hard enough to make the competition less.

about.statement: I'm passionate about building intelligent robotic systems that bridge the gap between artificial intelligence and real-world mechanical systems. My focus spans autonomous navigation, computer vision, and embedded control — driven by the belief that robotics will reshape how we interact with the physical world.

highlights.title: Education
highlights.description: DY Patil College of Engineering, Pune — pursuing excellence in robotics and automation engineering.

highlights.title: Experience
highlights.description: Hands-on research and internship work in ROS-based simulation, autonomous systems, and embedded control.

highlights.title: Achievements
highlights.description: Ready to work hard enough to make the competition less. Building towards a career at the frontier of robotics.

timeline.title: Started Engineering Journey
timeline.institution: DY Patil College of Engineering, Pune

skills.note: Strong foundations in systems-level and scripting languages for robotics applications.
End-to-end experience with industry-standard robotics frameworks and simulators.
Hands-on prototyping with microcontrollers and sensor integration.
Applying machine learning and computer vision to autonomous decision-making.

accomplishments: Developed ROS2 nodes for autonomous navigation in simulated warehouse environments
Implemented SLAM algorithms using LiDAR data for real-time map generation
Reduced path planning computation time by 40% through optimized A* implementation
Collaborated with a team of 5 researchers on sensor fusion pipelines
Designed PID controllers for quadcopter stability in outdoor flight tests
Integrated IMU and GPS modules for autonomous waypoint navigation
Wrote firmware in C++ for STM32-based flight controllers

achievements.title: Best Innovation Award — College Tech Fest 2023
Published research paper on autonomous navigation
Completed 500+ hours of robotics simulation projects
